content.content: Fridrich Method (CFOP) - Reduced version
Step 1: Cross
Like the beginner's method, the first step is to do the cross. This step will not be explained here since you already know how to do it, right?
Step 2: F2L (First Two Layers)

The main idea to complete the first two layers is, unlike the beginner's method where you need to put the corner of the first layer and then the edge on top of it, in this method you need to put those two pieces (edge and corner) on the top face, separated from each other. That should be easy to do. Then, there are three cases you need to handle.
Case 1: The corner has white on top

cubes.text: Put the edge with the corresponding side center

cubes.scramble: z2 R U2 R' U2 R U2 R'

cubes.text: Move the layer of the edge to the opposite side of where it needs to go

cubes.scramble: z2 R U2 R' U2 R U2

cubes.text: Join the corner with the edge

cubes.scramble: z2 R U2 R' U2 R
z2 R U2 R' U2

content.content: Insert the pair

To insert the pair, you should follow along with this simple steps:
1- Put the corner next to the pair, on top of the spot where the pair goes.
2- Take the pieces of that spot and move it to the top face.
3- Replace that pieces with the pair.
4- Undo the second step.

cubes.text: Corner on top of the spot

cubes.scramble: z2 R U R'
z2 R U
z2 R
z2

content.content: Case 2: Top color matches

cubes.scramble: z2 R U R' U2 R U2 R' U

cubes.text: Put the corner over the place where it needs to go and "push" the white sticker

cubes.scramble: z2 R U R' U2 R U2 R'

cubes.text: Move the corner to the bottom layer

cubes.scramble: z2 R U R' U2 R U2

cubes.text: Move the edge to the edge parallel to the previous moved face with the corner.

cubes.scramble: z2 R U R' U2 R

cubes.text: Move up the corner and insert the pair

cubes.scramble: z2 R U R' U2

content.content: Case 3: Top color doesn't matches

cubes.scramble: z2 R U' R' U' R U' R' U

cubes.text: Repeat the previous case but move the edge to the opposite direction

cubes.scramble: z2 R U' R' U' R U' R' U2
z2 R U' R' U' R U' R' U2 F' U F
z2 R U' R' U' R U' R' U2 F' U F U'

cubes.text: Now, join the corner with the edge, and insert.

cubes.scramble: z2 R U' R' U' R U' R' U2 F' U F  U' R
z2 R U' R' U' R U' R' U2 F' U F U' R U
z2 R U' R' U' R U' R' U2 F' U F U' R U R'

content.content: Middle step: The yellow cross
After you finished the first two layers, you need to do the yellow cross. Like the white cross, this step will be skipped since you already are a master of the yellow cross.
Step 3: OLL (Orientation of the Last Layer)
This step is needed to orientate all of the pieces of the top layer (all yellow). You don't need to worry about the side color, that's for the final step.
OLL #1: R U R' U R U2 R'

cubes.scramble: z2 R U2 R' U' R U' R'

cubes.text: R U R' U R U2 R'

cubes.scramble: z2

content.content: OLL #2: R' U' R U' R' U2 R

cubes.scramble: z2 R' U2 R U R' U R

cubes.text: R' U' R U' R' U2 R

cubes.scramble: z2

content.content: OLL #3: (R U2 R' U') (R U R' U') R U' R'

cubes.scramble: z2 R U2 R' U' R U R' U' R U' R' U'

cubes.text: (R U2 R' U') (R U R' U') R U' R'

cubes.scramble: z2

content.content: OLL #4: R U2 R2 U' R2 U' R2 U2 R

cubes.scramble: z2 R U2 R2 U' R2 U' R2 U2 R

cubes.text: R U2 R2 U' R2 U' R2 U2 R

cubes.scramble: z2

content.content: OLL #5: R2 D R' U2 R D' R' U2 R'

cubes.scramble: z2 R U2 R D R' U2 R D' R2

cubes.text: R2 D R' U2 R D' R' U2 R'

cubes.scramble: z2

content.content: OLL #6: r U R' U' r' F R F'

cubes.scramble: z2 F R' F' r U R U' r'

cubes.text: r U R' U' r' F R F'

cubes.scramble: z2

content.content: OLL #7: F' r U R' U' r' F R

cubes.scramble: z2 R' F' r U R U' r' F

cubes.text: F' r U R' U' r' F R

cubes.scramble: z2

content.content: PLL-Setup

Before of diving into PLL, we need to do a little setup move. That setup is an algorithm of the PLL family called Aa. What it does is that it cicles 3 corners, but in practical terms, what we need to do is follow along the next procedure:
1- Find two adjacent corners that are correct to each other (same color in the side).
1.1- If there are no two corners solved relative to each other, then go directly to the step (3) and come back to (1).
2- Place them in the back face (by doing U, U' or U2).
3- Do Aa.

The main idea is to solve all the corners. That leads us to the next and final step: to solve the edges.

Aa: x R' U R' D2 R U' R' D2 R2 x'
3x3x3 Beginner's tutorial

First of all, lets define the naming convention for all the pieces. There are three different types of pieces, centers, edges and corners. The centers are the pieces who define the color of that layer, since they are fixed (internally). Each layer has it's own name relative to the position that we're holding the cube (Front, Back, Left, Right, Up, Down). For instance, the name of the right face is the letter R. Since there are three posible moves that we can do in each layer (clockwise, counterclocwise, double turn), we call them in this case R, R' and R2.
Step 1: The white cross.

To do the cross, we will first look at every edge that has a white sticker on it, and bring that piece to the opposite layer, the yellow one. The next image shows how the cube should look like. The gray pieces tells us that those pieces doesn't matter for this step, so they can be any piece. It's VERY IMPORTANT to hold the cube ALWAYS with the yellow layer on top.

content.scramble: z2 U2 L2 U2 F2 D2 R2 F' R2 B2 U2 F2 U B' L' R2 B2 F' D L' D' B2

content.text: Move the white stickers to the top

content.content: Once all the white stickers are placed at the top layer, we need to move them to their position. For that, we need to align the side stickers with their colors (we'll take the orange-white edge in the next example), one by one and moving that layer twice, in order to move the white sticker to the white layer (at the bottom).
Step 2: The corners.

Now that we have the white cross, we need to find the corners on the top that contains a white sticker. Then, we move the top layer until that piece is above of the position where it needs to go. (Focus on the white-orange-blue corner on top)

content.text: Corner on top of the spot.

content.content: Once we have that corner on top of where it needs to go, we will repeat the next sequence until the corner is solved: R U R' U'. That sequence is called the "Sexy Move" (Right face Clockwise, Up face Clockwise, Right face Counterclockwise and Up face Counterclockwise).

Now we need to follow the same procedure until the rest of the corners are in place, that way we can complete the first layer.

If there isn't white stickers on top and the bottom layer is unsolved, hold the cube such as the bottom corner that is unsolved is at the front-right-bottom position and do the Sexy Move, that will bring the corner to the top face.
Step 3: The middle layer.
Similar to the previous step, we need to find an edge at the top face who doesn't contains a yellow sticker, then, align that piece's side sticker with the corresponding center, as the image shows.

content.scramble: F U F' R' U2 R U' L U L'

content.content: Now we have two cases that are exactly the same but mirrored. If the edge needs to go to the left (like the red-green piece in the image), we need to do the INVERSE Sexy Move with the left hand, then rotate the cube to see the white sticker, and do again the inverse Sexy Move but with the right hand. If the edge needs to go to the right, do the exact same process but with the right hand first and then the left hand. Using the notation, for the right hand is U R U' R' and for the left hand is U' L' U L.

content.text: Move the cube to see the white sticker

content.content: That process should be repeated until the first two layers (F2L) are solved. If it happens that at the top face there are no pieces that needs to be moved to the central layer but the F2L are not solved yet, you need to repeat the same step but this time, to replace one of the unsolved edges with any edge on top.
Step 4: The yellow cross.

There are only three cases we need to take care of. The next image shows the transition from each case to another until the yellow cross is finished. To do that, hold the cube in the position relative to the case you have and do: F Sexy Move F'. F stands for the front face.

content.scramble: U' R' U R U B U' B' U2 L' U L U F U' F' U L U' L' U' B' U B F U R U' R' F'
F R U R' U' F' U2
F R U R' U' F'
F R U R' U' F'

content.content: Step 5: Solve the top edges.

As usual, now we have 3 different cases: all the top edges are solved, two opposite edges are solved or two adjacent edges are solved. If you don't know which case do you have, just move the U layer and check until you see one of the three cases. The first one is our goal, so let's start for the second one. From any position, do the next sequence: R' U' R U' R' U2 R U'.

That sequence (called Anti-Sune) is easy to remember, since the R layer is going back and forth and the U layer is always counterclockwise except for the U2. Finally, if we have two adjacent edges solved, we need to move the top face until they are at the front and right layers, as it's shown next. Then perform Anti-Sune.

content.scramble: R' U' R U' R' U2 R U'

content.content: Step 6: Place the corners.

If you look at the next image, the yellow-red-green corner is at the correct spot. That's the thing we're after in this step, so you need to check if there is any corner at the correct spot, and move the whole cube until you have that correct corner at the front-up-left spot (THE WHOLE CUBE, NOT JUST THE TOP FACE). Then, do the next sequence: R U' L' U R' U' L U.

Notice that this is also an easy sequence, since the left face does the same moves of the right face, and the top face goes back and forth. If all the corners are not solved yet, do the sequence again.

If there isn't a corner at the correct spot, do the sequence and then check the corners.

content.scramble: R U' L' U R' U' L U
R U' L' U R' U' L U
R U' L' U R' U' L U

content.content: Step 7: Twist the corners.

This is our last step now!!! Lets rotate the whole cube to place the white layer at the top. Now, we need to have at the front-bottom-right corner, one of the corner that wee need to twist. Once we have that, we need to repeat the Sexy Move two times and check whether the piece is twisted correctly. Please, don't panic if the cube looks scrambled, just keep going.

If the piece is solved, we need to move the bottom layer to put in that place (front-bottom-right corner) another unsolved corner and then repeat.

content.scramble: R U R' U' R U R' U'
R U R' U' R U R' U'
R U R' U' R U R' U'

content.content: Step 8: Enjoy!!.

Now you can feel proud of yourself. Feel free to post in all the social medias that now, you belong to the group of people who actually knows how to solve a Rubik's Cube. Keep practicing and playing with the cube, and welcome to the Olympus.
